    • Method Detail

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        returns the name of the character.
        Returns:
        String containing the name

      • setName

        public void setName(java.lang.String name)
             throws MudException
        Sets the name of the person. Should contain only alphabetical characters, but has to have at least size of 3.
        Parameters:
        name - the (new) name.
        Throws:
        MudException - if the name is not allowed.

      • getAddress

        public java.lang.String getAddress()

      • setAddress

        public void setAddress(java.lang.String address)

      • getPassword

        public java.lang.String getPassword()

      • setPassword

        public void setPassword(java.lang.String password)
                 throws MudException
        Sets the password of the person. Can contain any character, but has to have at least size of 5. You cannot set a password this way, you can only set it for the first time, i.e. when creating a new character.
        Parameters:
        password - the new password.
        Throws:
        MudException - if the password is not allowed.

      • getDescription

        public java.lang.String getDescription()
        Returns the description of the character. All characteristics, if possible, are taken into account. Does not provide any info on the name or title. It contains a strictly visual cue.
        Returns:
        String containing the description

      • verifySessionPassword

        public boolean verifySessionPassword(java.lang.String aSessionPassword)
        verify sessionpassword
        Parameters:
        aSessionPassword - the sessionpassword to be verified.
        Returns:
        boolean, true if the sessionpassword provided is an exact match with the original sessionpassword.

      • isUser

        public boolean isUser()
        Indicates if this is a common user. This means it indicates that it is basically someone behind a keyboard.
        Returns:
        true if it is a common user (or a god/administrator), false otherwise.

      • generateSessionPassword

        public void generateSessionPassword()
        generate a session password to be used by player during game session. Use getLok() to return a String containing 25 random digits, capitals and smallcaps.

        public int hashCode()
        Overrides:

      • activate

        public void activate(java.lang.String address)
              throws MudException
        activate a character
        Throws:
        MudException

      • writeMessage

        public void writeMessage(java.lang.String aMessage)
                  throws MudException
        writes a message to the log file of the character that contains all communication and messages.

        Important! : Use this method only for Environmental communication, as it does not check the Ignore Flag. Use the writeMessage(Person aSource, String aMessage) for specific communication between users.

        Parameters:
        aMessage - the message to be written to the logfile.
        Throws:
        MudException
        See Also:
        #writeMessage(Person aSource, Person aTarget, String aMessage), #writeMessage(Person aSource, String aMessage)
